revised_title: John Wilfrid Linnett: A Life in Chemistry and Education
tldr: This article is a biographical memoir of John Wilfrid Linnett, a prominent British chemist and educator. It covers his early life, family background, education at King Henry VIII School and St. John's College, Oxford, and his career in chemistry. Linnett made significant contributions to the field of spectroscopy and photochemistry, and was an active member of the Royal Society. The memoir also highlights his dedication to education, serving as a governor for several schools and institutions.
